title: Determining GPP from solar energy - graph

content.description: The graph shows the relative solar energy received at local noon each day of the year at two different locations.
content.question: Assuming all other variables are constant, which of the following is the most likely conclusion about the greatest potential for gross primary productivity that can be supported by data in the graph?

choices.label: Gross primary productivity is the same for both locations all year.
Gross primary productivity in Location 2 is greater than that in Location 1 in December.
Gross primary productivity in Location 1 is greater than that in Location 2 in March.
Gross primary productivity in Location 2 is greater than that in Location 1 in September.

content.answer: Gross primary productivity in Location 1 is greater than that in Location 2 in March.

skill.text: Skill 5.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
